result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (2nd) and Operating w/ PAC (2nd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (2nd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (2nd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Charles E. Anderson was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Prior to re-licensing the defendant is to complete an OWI Assessment.

miscConds.notes: Costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

Court orders bond in the amount of $550.00 to be applied. Balance of costs to be paid directly to the Waushara County Clerk of Court within 60 days or establish a payment plan.  Failure to pay may result in suspension of your driver's license, tax intercept, a civil judgment being entered against you, a warrant being issued for your arrest for contempt and/or the debt being turned over to a collection agency.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.
Defendant is to comply with any rules/recommendations as deemed appropriate by the supervising agent.   DNA sample to be provided and surcharge assessed.

timeConds.notes: With Huber and Good Time Credit.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Charles E. Anderson

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Order for intox driver assessment and safety plan

records.addlTxt: 10:20 am case called. Defendant Charles E. Anderson in court.  Steven Paul Anderson appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Agreement stated on the record by ADA Anderson. Defendant concurs.   Defendant advised of right to counsel and expertise.  Voluntary waiver of counsel accepted by Court.  Defendant advised of minimum/maximum penalty.  Plea colloquy entertained.  Collateral consequences explained. Chapter 950 compliance addressed. Plea: Guilty to Count 1.  Court accepts plea and enters JOC.  Court dismisses outright Count 2. Statement by defendant. Court sentences the defendant to: SWD and places the defendant on probation for a period of 18 months. CONDITONS: 5 days WCJ, with Huber and Good Time Credit. Credit for 1 day served. To begin service no later than February 1, 2016. $1,429.00 fine inclusive of costs to be paid within 60 days or payment plan. 12 month DL revocation, 12 Month IID-effective today. AODA & follow through, Maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician. Terms of Agent. DNA Sample and Surcharge ordered by the Court.  Defendant advised of right to expunge DNA record through the Department of Justice. Bond to be applied. Appeal Rights Given.

Pre-trial conference at 11-12-2015 10:30 am.
Status conference at 12-08-2015 10:25 am.

The defendant must maintain absolute sobriety, may not be present upon the premises of any bars, and is prohibited from possessing/ingesting any impairing substances that have not been prescribed by a physician.   No operation of any motor vehicles without a valid driver's license.

Case Called @ 3:05 PM: Defendant Charles E. Anderson in court.  Scott C. Blader appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Complaint Stated - Advised of offense and minimum/maximum penalty.  Receipt Admitted - Reading Waived.  Advised of right of Counsel.  Def wants counsel - no funds to retain his own counsel.  Employed full time - earnings will disqualify him from SPD services.  Def requesets to speak directly with the State without counsel.   NGP entered by Court.   PTC/STC Scheduled - NOH Given.  Court enters Riverside Ruling in favor of the State and probable cause finding as to each count alleged within the complaint.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 12, 2015 at 10:30 am.  Status conference scheduled for December 8, 2015 at 10:25 am.
